sid.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Key resource.

friendly_name.description: The string that you assigned to describe the resource.

date_created.description: The date and time in GMT that the resource was created specified in [RFC 2822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt) format.

date_updated.description: The date and time in GMT that the resource was last updated specified in [RFC 2822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt) format.

sid.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Key resource.

friendly_name.description: The string that you assigned to describe the resource.

date_created.description: The date and time in GMT that the resource was created specified in [RFC 2822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt) format.

date_updated.description: The date and time in GMT that the resource was last updated specified in [RFC 2822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt) format.

policy.description:
The \`Policy\` object is a collection that specifies the allowed Twilio permissions for the restricted key.
For more information on the permissions available with restricted API keys, refer to the [Twilio documentation](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api-keys/restricted-api-keys#permissions-available-with-restricted-api-keys).

sid.description: The unique string that that we created to identify the NewKey resource. You will use this as the basic-auth `user` when authenticating to the API.

friendly_name.description: The string that you assigned to describe the resource.

date_created.description: The date and time in GMT that the API Key was created specified in [RFC 2822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt) format.

date_updated.description: The date and time in GMT that the new API Key was last updated specified in [RFC 2822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt) format.

secret.description: The secret your application uses to sign Access Tokens and to authenticate to the REST API (you will use this as the basic-auth `password`).  **Note that for security reasons, this field is ONLY returned when the API Key is first created.**

access_token.description: Token which carries the necessary information to access a Twilio resource directly.

refresh_token.description: Token which carries the information necessary to get a new access token.

id_token.description: Token which carries the information necessary of user profile.

domainSignupType.description: User sign-up type for Organization domains
User sign-up type for Organization domains

verificationType.description: Type of verification used for the domain

dateLastVerification.description: Date where the domain was last verified

daysLeftToReverify.description: Days left to re-verify until this domain gets back into 'unverified' state. Only applicable to domains in 'verified-uncertain' state

verifiedByAnotherResource.description: Whether the domain is verified by another resource. Only applicable to domains in 'verified' state

sso.description: Whether the user has SSO enabled

ssoEnabled.description: Whether the user has SSO enabled

roleAssignments.description: List of role assignments for the user

sid.description: Unique identifier for the role assignment

scope.description: SID of the entity that the role is scoped to (AC…, OR…, etc)

scopeName.description: Scope Name e.g. Account or Organization friendly name

dateCreated.description: Date and time when the role assignment was created

id.description: Unique identifier for the import run

numUsersNotImported.description: Number of users that were not imported

startDate.description: Start date and time of the import run

finishDate.description: Finish date and time of the import run

name.description: Social Connection Name (e.g. google, github etc)

dateCreated.description: The creation date and time of the social connection

emailVerified.description: Whether the user email is verified or not

sso.description: Whether the user has SSO enabled

socialConnections.description: List of social connections associated with the user

timeZone.description: The user's timezone in IANA Time Zone Database format
The user's timezone in IANA Time Zone Database format

code.description: The verification code sent to the new email address

phoneVerified.description: Whether the phone number has been verified.

totpVerified.description: Whether TOTP setup has been verified.

enrolledInMfa.description: Whether the user is enrolled in any MFA.

canEnrollInTotp.description: Whether the user is allowed to enroll in TOTP.

isSSO.description: Whether the user authenticated via SSO.

isMfaDisabled.description: Whether MFA is disabled for this user.

isRecoveryCodeGenerated.description: Whether a recovery code has been generated for the user.

Token.description: A TOTP token generated by an authenticator app.

otpAuthQrCodeUrl.description: The QrCodeUrl of the TOTP factor

iam.v1.ChallengeMethod.description: The method used to challenge the user (e.g. “SMS”, “TOTP”).

senderFirstName.description: First name of the sender who invited the account

senderLastName.description: Last name of the sender who invited the account

senderEmail.description: Email of the sender who invited the account

dateCreated.description: The date and time of the invitation creation

dateLastSent.description: The date and time of the last invitation sent

tokenExpired.description: Whether the invitation token has expired

canResend.description: Whether the invitation can be resent

canResendReason.description: Reason why the invitation cannot be resent, if applicable

domainName.description: The name of the organization domain

userCount.description: The number of users that can be imported into the organization

scope.description: The SID of the entity that the role is scoped to (AC…, OR…, etc)

scopeName.description: Scope Name e.g. Account or Organization friendly name

roleSid.description: List of role SIDs assigned for the scope

newOwnerSid.description: The SID of the new owner to transfer the account to

executionSid.description: The SID of the workflow that will handle the account ownership change

ownerId.description: The owner of the account to be provisioned.

parentAccountId.description: The parent account ID of the subaccount to be provisioned.

parentId.description: ID of the operation's parent operation, if applicable

dateCreated.description: The date that this Operation was created, given in RFC 2822 format.

dateCompleted.description: The date that the Operation was completed, if applicable.

links.description:
Links to resources related to the operation.
Common links include:
  - `self`: link to this operation
  - `childOperations`:  link to child operations of this operation

input.description: A polymorphic input object. Fields vary depending on the operation.

result.description:
A polymorphic result object. Fields vary depending on the operation.
Common fields include:
  - `resourceId`: string

reason.description: The reason for the failure of the operation, if applicable.

message.description: A human-readable error message describing the error, if applicable.
message.example: The account limit has been exceeded.

ownerId.description: The owner of the account to be provisioned.

status.description: The current status of the account provisioning operation

accountId.description: The ID of the provisioned account (only available when status is SUCCEEDED)

reason.description: The reason for the failure of the operation, if applicable.

message.description: A human-readable error message describing the error, if applicable.
message.example: The account limit has been exceeded.

executionSid.description: The SID of the workflow that will handle the account ownership change

info.title: Twilio - Iam
info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Keys for a account.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the Payments resource.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: Specify the origin(s) allowed to access the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: Specify the HTTP methods allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: Specify the headers allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials

post.description: Create a new Signing Key for the account making the request.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: Specify the origin(s) allowed to access the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: Specify the HTTP methods allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: Specify the headers allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials

AccountSid.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the Payments resource.

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.

KeyType.description:
The \`KeyType\` form parameter is used to specify the type of key you want to create.

**Default Behavior**: If \`KeyType\` is not specified, the API will generate a standard key.

**Restricted Key**: If \`KeyType\` is set to \`restricted\`, the API will create a new restricted key. In this case, a policy object is required to define the permissions.

Policy.description:
The \`Policy\` object is a collection that specifies the allowed Twilio permissions for the restricted key.
For more information on the permissions available with restricted API keys, refer to the [Twilio documentation](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api-keys/restricted-api-keys#permissions-available-with-restricted-api-keys).

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Key resource to fetch.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: Specify the origin(s) allowed to access the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: Specify the HTTP methods allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: Specify the headers allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Key resource to update.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: Specify the origin(s) allowed to access the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: Specify the HTTP methods allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: Specify the headers allowed when accessing the resource

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the browser should include credentials

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.

Policy.description:
The \`Policy\` object is a collection that specifies the allowed Twilio permissions for the restricted key.
For more information on the permissions available with restricted API keys, refer to the [Twilio documentation](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api-keys/restricted-api-keys#permissions-available-with-restricted-api-keys).

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Key resource to delete.

post.summary: Issues a new Access token (optionally identity_token & refresh_token) in exchange of Oauth grant

grant_type.description: Grant type is a credential representing resource owner's authorization which can be used by client to obtain access token.

client_id.description: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this OAuth App.

client_secret.description: The credential for confidential OAuth App.

code.description: JWT token related to the authorization code grant type.

refresh_token.description: JWT token related to refresh access token.
